page.title: 07DONCASTER'S LEISURE PLANS
page.content: Recreation will be something very special in Doncaster in the future. Despite much opposition the Council is going ahead with its plans for a multi-million Â£ leisure complex on the carr land to the south of the town. It will consist of: indoor and outdoor heated swimming pools, sports halls, restaurants,bowls hall, badminton,tennis and squash courts, martial arts area, ski-slopes, climbing walls,go-cart track, golf driving range, nature walks and 60 acres of artificial lake for water sports. All this should be ready for the 1990s. Opposition comes mainly from Doncaster Airport Club who will lose its runway. In its favour the centre would provide much employment and give Doncaster a development of national importance.
